document.docAuthor: Zeppelini, Douglas, Brito, Roniere A. & Lima, Estevam C. A.
document.docTitle: Pseudosinella ambigua Zeppelini & Brito & Lima 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of Collembola (Arthropoda: Hexapoda) from Central Brazilian shallow caves: side effects of long term application of environmental law on conservation

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype
adult male on slide, Brazil , Minas Gerais , Pedro Leopoldo ( 19°37′4″S , 44°2′34″W ), Holc-99, Limestone Cave ,
02–14.VII.2016
, leg. Carste Team.
Holotype deposited at CRFS-UEPB # 10505
.

Paratype adult, male on slide Brazil , Minas Gerais , Pedro Leopoldo , ( 19°37′4″S , 44°2′34″W ) Holc-0106, Limestone cave ,
02–14.VI.2016
, leg. Carste Team.
Paratype deposited at CRFS-UEPB # 10506
.

Adult female on slide, Brazil , Minas Gerais , Conceição do Mato Dentro ( 43°25'30"W ; 19°02'13"S ). CSS-0113, Iron cave ,
31.V–12.VI.2016
, leg. Carste Team , CRFS-UEPB # 10500 and #10501
.

Adult , Brazil , Minas Gerais , Serra do Gandarela , ( 43°39’08”W ; 20°02’28”) Gand-038, Limestone cave ,
14.VII–18.X.2016
, leg. Carste Team , CRFS-UEPB # 10504
.

Adult , Brazil , Minas Gerais , Pains , ( 45°36’31”W ; 20°21’24”) ICPA-018, Limestone cave ,
18.III–06.IV.2013
. leg. Bueno , CRFS-UEPB # 10503
.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Adult , Brazil , Minas Gerais , Matozinhos , ( 44°05’34”W ; 19°31’56”) BM98 , Limestone Cave ,
15.VIII– 08.IX.2016
, Spelayon Team. Holotype deposited at CRFS-UEPB # 10502 .

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Color Pattern: White, without pigment. Total length of Holotype (head and body) 1115µm, other measurements in Table 1 . Scale present on head, body and ventral face of furca; absent from antennae, legs and collophore.

Head: Eyes absent. Antennae ~ 1.4× head length. Ant. II–IV with many blunt sensilla, most sensilla long and slender, some short and stout ( Fig. 17 ). Ant. IV apical papilla absent; subapical sense organ with a type a sensillum ( Fig. 17 ), guard sensillum shorter than organ sensillum. Apical sense organ of Ant. III with 2 type b sensilla, surrounded by 3 type l and 1 type h sensilla and guarded by two macrochaetae. Head dorsally ( Fig. 18 ) with 6 macrochaetae in series An; anterior unpaired A0-1 and paired A2–3 as macrochaetae, paired A5 as microchaeta, A4 absent. Posterior chaetae all small and slender microchaetae but for a posterior marginal line of macrochaetae. Labral chaetotaxy Pl,p,m,a 5,5,4,4, Pl and p ciliated, m and a roughly serrated. Basal and distal chaetae of maxillary palp smooth and subequal; lateral process of labial papilla E (sensillum Ip) curled anteriorly around the base of E, just reaching the tip of the papillae.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 17–18.
Pseudosinella ambigua
sp. nov.
: 17, antennal and body chaetae: a) subapical micro sense rod. b) sense type I. c) sense type II. d) sense type III. e) sense type IV. f) bristle-like. g) ciliated chaeta. h) microsensillum. i) micro sense organ. j) sense type V. l) sense type VI. m) fan-shaped chaeta type I. n) fan-shaped chaeta type II. o) micro or mesochaeta symbol. p) macrochaeta symbols. q) pseudopore symbols. r) bothriotrix. s) stout ciliated macrochaetae; 18, dorsal cephalic chaetotaxy.

FIGURES 19–20.
Pseudosinella ambigua
sp. nov.
: 19, labial triangle chaetotaxy, right side; 20, trunk chaetotaxy, right side.

FIGURES 21–25.
Pseudosinella ambigua
sp. nov.
: 21, Abd IV dorsal chaetotaxy; 22, empodial complex leg III; 23, ventral tube anterior side (left); 24, Ventral tube posterior side (rigth); 25, mucro.

subSubSection.paragraph: Body: Body macrochaetae 00/0100+2. Metathorax sensillum as long and slender. Abd. I with a1, a4, a5, a6, as, m2–6, p5 and p6, sensillum as large and blunt ( Figs 20 and 21 ). Abd. II with macrochaetae m3, m3e and m4; trichobothria Tm2 and Ta5 each with 3 supplementary (a2, a2i, a2ii and a6, a6i, a6ii) fan-shaped chaetae; a3 smooth and slender reaching microsensillum as , as present next to a2; microchaeta p4, m6 and p5–7 smooth ( Fig. 20 ). Abd. III with macrochaetae m6 and p6; trichobothria Tm2, Ta5 and Tm5 with 4,4,3 fan-shaped supplementary chaetae; a2 fan-shaped; a3 internal and not reaching as ; as large, rodlike and blunt, bigger than m3; sensilla d2 present ( Fig. 20 ). Abd. IV inner macrochaetae A6, B5 and T2 present, C1 normal; macrochaeta B5 anterior to pseudopore, aligned to T4. Trichobothrial complex a and m chaetae present, s absent, supplementary chaetae a , m and D1; chaeta D1p slender, D2 slender and bristlelike, longest of all chaetae in trichobothrial complex. D4–D5, E2–5, F3 and F5 as large lateral macrochaetae ( Fig. 21 ).

Legs: Metatrochanteral organ with up to 8 short chaetae in V shape and 2 lateral microchaeta, other 10 ciliate mesochaetae present. Third unguis as in Fig. 22 , tenent hair flat and truncate, 1.5× as long as unguiculus; all ungues with 2 unpaired apical inner teeth and a paired basal tooth close to the mid-length of the inner lamella. Unguiculus lanceolate, posteriorly serrated at the apex ( Fig. 22 ).

Etymology : The species is called ‘
ambigua
’ by causing some confusion during the chaetotaxic analysis until it was separated from
P. guanhaensis
sp. nov.

Remarks.
Pseudosinella ambigua
sp. nov.
can be differentiated from other blind
Pseudosinella
(
P. josemarii Soto-Adames, 2010
,
P. meganporteri Soto-Adames, 2010
,
P. sera Christiansen & Bellinger, 1980
,
P. certa Christiansen & Bellinger, 1980
,
P. argentea Folsom, 1902
) by the presence of 3 macrochaetae on Abd. II ( Table 2 ) and the sensillum Ip of the labial palp is curled around the papilla. The macrochaetae S and T on head is similar to
P. megaporteri
, they can be distinguished in the basis of the tenent hair, which is acuminate in the
P. megaporteri
and flat and clavate in
P. ambigua
sp. nov.
, and the former species presents macrochaetae in the thorax as a diagnostic character. The position of the inner teeth on ungues is also a differential character for the new species. A comparison among blind
Pseudosinella species
is given in Table 2 .
